Российской молодежи посоветовали не проводить за гаджетами больше трех часов в день
02 Nov 2019, 12:31 by Алексей Громов

По мнению специалистов РНИМУ им. Пирогова и Северного государственного медицинского университета, современная молодежь должна тратить на использование гаджетов не более трех часов в день. Иначе есть риск возникновения различных заболеваний.

Специалисты РНИМУ им. Пирогова и Северного государственного медицинского университета выяснили, что максимальное безопасное время, которое молодые люди могут уделять на компьютер и другие гаджеты — не более трех часов в день. Об этом пишет RT, который ознакомился с результатами исследования.
Так, эксперты рекомендуют школьникам и студентам проводить за смартфонами и ноутбуками до трех часов в день, так как у тех, кто уделяет гаджетам больше времени, повышается риск развития физических отклонений.
Кроме того, среди возможных проблем со здоровьем исследователи назвали близорукость, психические и неврологические отклонения и нарушения работы опорно-двигательного аппарата. Также частое использование устройств с наушниками может увеличить вероятность заболеваний органов слуха.
Специалисты уточнили, что из-за увлечения гаджетами современная молодежь уделяет меньше времени сну, прогулкам и спорту. Например, школьники тратят на сон на 9 % меньше времени, а на прогулки и занятия спортом — на 6 %. Студенты тратят на сон на 7 % меньше времени, а на прогулки и занятия спортом — на 4 %. Отмечается, что в исследовании приняли участие 465 старшеклассников (16 лет) и 598 студентов (20 лет) из трех регионов России.
Ранее НЕВСКИЕ НОВОСТИ писали, что эксперты рассказали о проблеме, позволяющей превратить смартфон в звуковое оружие уязвимости.

"History is a common good": the exhibits of the Great War on display
MONTECOSARO - The city celebrates November 4 in the council chamber. On display now unobtainable pieces of the armament of the two fronts
02 Nov 2019, 12:02 by Gabriele Censi
Share144TweetEmail144 Shares
by Maurizio Verdenelli
"History is a common good". Reano Malaisi, mayor of Montecosaro, adopted (like Unimc) perfectly the message that last June they entrusted Andrea Camilleri (a month before he died), Liliana Segre and Andrea Giardina to a manifesto for the study and knowledge of history. . Malaisi has even cleared the council chamber and postponed, albeit in the very short term, a civic assembly to allow the preparation of an exhibition of European value, with very rare finds, on the First World War within a program until next Saturday which puts at the center the terrible period of 'fascist' wars from 1934 until '45 in the common theme of 'November 4th'.


Reano Malaisi and Luca Cimarosa

A week of research and study on our contemporaneity, to which school textbooks sometimes do not offer the deserved depth, involving schools starting from elementary school. A very good program curated by the National Combatants and Veterans Association ("Luigi Torresi" section of Montecosaro), with the provincial president Albino Mataloni and Maceratese, Mario Massimi (Macerata). The contribution of the Centro Studi Montecosaresi, headed by Fabrizio Quattrini, was fundamental, presenting an exceptional film with clips of Austrian documentaries (centered on the emperor Francesco Giuseppe just before Sarajevo) and Germans, expertly mounted, calling for the installation of the exhibition the famous collector Luca Cimarosa. Which presented now almost impossible-to-find pieces of the armament of the two fronts: shrimp-tailed armor plates for single infantrymen and trench armor, 'cervelliere', reinforced helmets, steel armor with a medieval flavor and terrible 'spikes' that came hidden in the deep snow by the Austrian army, and conventional weapons of all kinds. There are no historical references and testimonies related to the cavalry considered that the Conflict 1915-18 was the last in which the noble quadruped was used (and massacred).



To read the entire protocol of the provisions of the Royal Army about the use of armor and other "defensive devices" (see shields) was, after the ribbon cutting, the very young Nicolò Massini. Malaisi then lit the flame of a singular mini-tripod consisting essentially of a small hand grenade, an evocative find dating back to the Great War. "In which - said the mayor - Montecosaro has lost 68 of his very young sons, mostly in their twenties, mostly as a result of the injuries and horrendous mutilations that the new," barbaric "weapons for the first time introduced, provoked". A good part of the Montecosaresi youths mobilized lost their lives as a result of diseases contracted in the trenches and on the mountains at almost immediate freezing temperatures: the Adamello glacier, melting at 50% in recent years due to the changed weather, is returning many bodies and 'sad relics' of the First World War. Wanted for Italy, it reveals the audio of the video, from the king, the president of the Council and the delegated minister. The scenes of the victims of the 'decimations' desired by the generalissimo Luigi Cadorna and from which certainly did not distance themselves Gabriele D'Annunzio, whose speeches aimed at 'inflating' the troops, together with those of a very chaplain military chaplain, not surprisingly they "fell" before every bloody assault.
Luca Cimarosa says that in Loro Piceno he has set up two historical museums visited from abroad: "Montecosaro is a brilliant example of how a municipal administration also sets itself the task of illuminating history for the benefit of the whole community, in particular children, supporting school programs. An example that unfortunately I see not too much followed in the province, despite the occasion of the anniversaries, an illustrious past and the testimonies of blood and sacrifice offered by generations and generations of young people of this land, beginning with the dramatic epic of the ‘Brigata Macerata’
